page.title: 13Fishing Industry,Lurgan
page.content: The fishing rights of Lough Neagh are owned by the Toome Eel Fishing Company and licences are issued only by them. There are about 8 licenced fishing boats in the Lurgan area.They fish mainly for eels between May 1st and Oct.31st.At other times of the year they catch perch,which are a delicacy on the Continent,pollen and trout. Eels are caught by using a long line with hooks on it,or by net.The eels are marketed through the Toome Eel Fishing Company.They are shipped live to the Continent,where the most lucrative market is Germany,followed by Holland and France. Pollution,mainly from the Sewage Works,has made the condition of the Lough deteriorate badly recently.The Government is building plants to take the phosphates out of the water.
